meanings.definition: A type of resistor whose resistance is dependent on temperature.
meanings.sent1: The thermistor in the thermometer changes its resistance with heat.
meanings.sent2: The technician replaced the faulty thermistor in the temperature control system.
meanings.sent3: The thermistor at the party was always cold, no matter how hot the room got.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a thermistor, fluctuating with every passing moment.
meanings.sent5: The thermistor, like a chameleon, adapts its resistance to the surrounding temperature.

meanings.definition: A device used to measure temperature by its resistance.
meanings.sent1: The thermistor accurately gauges the room temperature in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The digital thermometer uses a thermistor to provide precise temperature readings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat mistook the thermistor for a toy and batted it around.
meanings.sent4: His intuition acted like a thermistor, sensing the emotional temperature of the room.
meanings.sent5: The thermistor hummed softly as it diligently measured the changing temperature.
